intro: Asphodelus fistulosus var. roseus, commonly known as the rose-flowered asphodel, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces striking, pink to rose-colored flower spikes in early spring. The flowers are typically arranged in dense clusters and bloom before the leaves fully develop. This plant thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in horticulture.
